items.title: Notice: Sizewell C: Funded Decommissioning Programme (FDP)
items.summary: The financing arrangements required to meet the full costs of decommissioning, waste management and disposal costs.

items.title: Putting fans first: consultation on the resale of live events tickets
items.summary: The government is consulting on proposals to strengthen consumer protections in relation to ticket resales.

items.title: Government bans ticket touting to protect fans from rip-offs
items.summary: New rules to make it illegal to resell tickets for live events above original cost

items.title: Government bans ticket touting to protect fans from rip-off prices
items.summary: Music and sport fans will no longer be ripped off on the ticket resale market thanks to new measures making it illegal to resell tickets for live events above original cost

items.title: Putting fans first: call for evidence on pricing practices in the live events sector
items.summary: The government is seeking evidence about pricing practices in the live events sector.

items.title: Notice: Electricity transmission license exemption: Dogger Bank A offshore wind farm
items.summary: A proposal to provide a time-limited exemption to Dogger Bank A offshore wind farm from the requirement to hold a transmission licence.

items.title: Notice: UK/New Zealand clean energy partnership: memorandum of cooperation
items.summary: UK Secretary of State Ed Miliband signed an MoC with New Zealand on clean energy cooperation at COP30.

items.title: Notice: CCUS East Coast Cluster: Teesside selection process
items.summary: DESNZ intends to launch a new ECC Teesside selection process in early 2026 to identify carbon capture projects for future connection.

items.title: Guidance: People with significant control: summary guidance
items.summary: This guidance gives an overview of people with significant control (PSC) requirements for companies. If you have a simple ownership and control structure, further guidance may not be needed.

items.title: Guidance: Register of people with significant control
items.summary: This guidance is for individuals who may be people with significant control (PSC). It explains the PSC requirements and how to comply with them.

items.title: Guidance: People with significant control: eligible Scottish partnerships guidance
items.summary: This guidance is for eligible Scottish partnerships (ESPs) and individuals who may be the people with significant control (PSCs) of ESPs. It provides an explanation of the PSC requirements and how to comply with them.

items.title: Guidance: People with significant control: guidance on regime for legal entities
items.summary: This guidance provides a detailed explanation of the people with significant control (PSC) requirements. Very complicated or large ownership or control structures may need independent advice.

items.title: Transparency data: Heat networks pipelines
items.summary: An overview of current and planned heat networks projects and procurements, including those supported by government funding.

items.title: Research: Renewable Energy Planning Database: quarterly extract
items.summary: A quarterly extract of the results of the renewable energy projects monitoring work.

items.title: Policy paper: Advanced Nuclear Technologies
items.summary: Information about Advanced Nuclear Technologies, previously known as Small Modular Reactors.

items.title: Research: Social enterprise: market trends 2023
items.summary: A report examining the size and characteristics of the social enterprise sector.

items.title: Research: Social enterprise: market trends 2021
items.summary: A report examining the size and characteristics of the social enterprise sector.

items.title: Make Work Pay: draft code of practice on electronic and workplace balloting for statutory union ballots
items.summary: We are consulting on a draft code of practice on electronic and workplace balloting for statutory trade union ballots.

items.title: Guidance: Employment rights for unpaid carers review: terms of reference
items.summary: Government review of carer’s leave and unemployment rights for unpaid carers.

items.title: Transparency data: UK Sustainability Disclosures Policy and Implementation Committee (PIC) meeting minutes for 2025
items.summary: Public summary meeting minutes from the UK Sustainability Disclosures Policy and Implementation Committee (PIC).

items.title: Guidance: Consumer savings schemes legislation for businesses
items.summary: Guidance on the new legal duties to protect money held in 'consumer savings schemes' under the Digital Markets Competition and Consumers Act 2024.

items.title: Guidance: FOI, EIR and Correspondence requests privacy notice
items.summary: How the Department for Business and Trade (DBT) processes personal data when we answer Freedom of Information (FOI), Environmental Information Regulations (EIR) and Correspondence requests.

items.title: Contact the Department for Business and Trade (DBT)
items.summary: Use this form to send a message to the Department for Business and Trade.

items.title: Guidance: DBT worldwide offices
items.summary: Contact details for Department for Business and Trade (DBT) offices around the world and a list of our HM Trade Commissioners.

items.title: Guidance: Heat networks regulation: technical standards
items.summary: We are introducing regulatory technical requirements and a Heat Network Technical Assurance Scheme (HNTAS) to help heat network operators demonstrate compliance with these requirements.

items.title: New Energy Resilience Strategy to better protect infrastructure
items.summary: A new government strategy will help safeguard critical energy infrastructure and protect consumers and businesses from costly disruption.

items.title: UK Internal Market Act 2020: review and consultation
items.summary: We are seeking views on what is and what is not working well about the UK Internal Market Act, so that we can quickly decide on next steps to make processes work better.

items.title: Decision: Jackdaw Field Development
items.summary: Project Summary

items.title: Transparency data: Help to Grow: Management course enrolments and participant completions
items.summary: Statistics on the uptake of the Help to Grow: Management programme, course enrolments and participant completions.

items.title: Accredited official statistics: Weekly road fuel prices
items.summary: Road fuel price statistics providing average UK retail 'pump' prices on a weekly basis.

items.title: Guidance: Capture Redress Scheme: legal costs framework
items.summary: This guidance sets out the legal costs the Department for Business and Trade (DBT) will cover for Capture Redress Scheme applicants.

items.title: Oil and gas: offshore environmental legislation
items.summary: Environmental regulations and guidance on offshore oil and gas exploration and production offshore gas unloading and storage and offshore carbon dioxide storage activities

items.title: Oil and gas: environmental submissions and determinations
items.summary: Interested parties can review records of applications and statements submitted to OPRED as required by environmental regulations.

items.title: Exploring the role of alternative clean heating solutions
items.summary: We are seeking views on low carbon heating technologies that could be used to decarbonise heat in the small number of properties that may not be suitable for heat pumps and heat networks.

items.title: Boiler Upgrade Scheme and certification requirements for clean heat schemes
items.summary: We're seeking views on proposed amendments to the existing Boiler Upgrade Scheme (BUS) and to certification requirements for BUS and other clean heat schemes.

items.title: Discounts for families to keep warm in winter and cool in summer
items.summary: Boiler Upgrade Scheme has been expanded to include air-to-air heat pumps and heat batteries giving families more choice in how they upgrade their home.

items.title: Policy paper: NESO’s North Hyde report: government response
items.summary: The government’s action plan to address the findings of NESO’s review into the incident at North Hyde Substation and commitment to ensuring GB energy resilience now and in the future.

items.title: Standard: Draft: Heat network technical standard (TS1)
items.summary: This draft technical standard sets out the minimum requirements necessary for the proper design, installation, and operation of Heat Networks.

items.title: Policy paper: Global Clean Power Alliance: finance mission country action plans
items.summary: Country action plans launched at COP30 with the Global Clean Power Alliance (GCPA) finance mission.

items.title: Schools to cut bills with Great British Energy solar panels
items.summary: Schools across England to cut bills with Great British Energy solar panels.
